example: The Earth's crust is made up of different tectonic plates.
The small town is located in a beautiful basin surrounded by mountains.
Movements of tectonic plates can cause earthquakes.
Asia is the largest continent in the world.
Magma can rise to the surface and form volcanoes.
A large rift has formed in the earth after the earthquake.
The moon is Earth's natural satellite.
The scientist made an extraordinary discovery in the field of geology.
Wind and water can erode the landscape over time.
Rocks are mostly inorganic materials.
The desert landscape is both beautiful and harsh.
Soil nutrients are essential for plant growth.
A bacterium is a tiny living organism.
Plants produce oxygen through photosynthesis.
Photosynthesis is vital for the survival of most organisms on Earth.
Primitive life forms existed on Earth billions of years ago.
The cake has multiple layers of different flavors.
There is a crack in the wall that needs to be repaired.
The large rock split into two pieces after the blast.
The sun's heat can melt the snow on the mountains.
A volcano erupted, sending ash and lava into the air.
Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.
A deep fissure opened up in the ground after the earthquake.
The clay will harden when it is fired in the kiln.
She found a strip of cloth in the old box.
Heavy rain caused a landslide that blocked the road.
Few plants can survive in the hot desert.
The road follows a gentle curve through the hills.
The tree's canopy provides shade on sunny days.
